Uses of Package
cs351.core

  • Packages that use cs351.core 
    Package Description
    cs351.core  
    cs351.entities  
    cs351.project1  
  • Classes in cs351.core used by cs351.core 
    Class and Description
    Actor
    The Actor class represents any object that can be added to the game and updated each frame.
    Actor.UpdateResult
    UpdateResult contains a few different enum values that each Actor can use to tell the Engine how the update went.
    Engine
    The Engine is the driving force behind a game.
    KeyboardInput
    Main key input class.
    KeyboardInput.Keys
    Keys enum used to identify the key pressed.
    Level
    A Level object represents the initial state of a World.
    RenderEntity
    CITATION: http://www.opengl-tutorial.org/beginners-tutorials/tutorial-7-model-loading/ The above website is really good for learning stuff about 3D programming.
    Renderer
    The Renderer is meant to manage the final translation/rotation of all registered models, lights, etc.
    Settings
    This class enables us to register global variables and to read in variables from a .settings file.
    SoundEngine
    The idea behind a SoundEngine is that each frame a number of objects can request that a sound be played relative to a central point (ex: a player location).
    Vector3
    Java's Point classes don't let you set a new value for the individual components, forcing you to create a new object even to make the smallest change.
    World
    A World object maintains the current state of all active objects that an Engine is working with.
